Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Therefore, as Albucasis has completed this book for you, which is the final part of the science of medicine, by completing it you will achieve its end, and by reading it, and by understanding it, I see that I should complete this treatise for you, which concerns surgery on the hand.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because surgery of the hand is entirely abandoned in our country and in our time, due to great peril, the science of it has diminished, and its tools have been lost; there remain only a few brief descriptions in the books of the ancients, which are mutilated and lead to error and confusion until their intentions are clarified and the strength of it is extended and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I see that I should bring this treatise to life according to the method of exposition and clarification and abbreviation; so that it comes with the forms of the tools for cauterization and other instruments used in the work, as well as the addition of clarification, and preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason that a good artisan cannot be found in this our time is because the art of medicine is long and requires the practitioner to have been trained in anatomy, which includes knowledge of the joints and the shapes of the members, as well as their connection and separation; having knowledge of bones, nerves and ligaments, as well as their number, and their origin; and the recognition of arteries, veins and quiet veins, and the locations for bleeding them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said in his work, "a name is much, but in small things, and especially in the art of surgery."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	And we have already said about this in the introduction of this book; because whoever is not knowledgeable in anatomy cannot avoid making errors that can lead to the death of men, as I have seen many times, for some are uneducated in this science and trust in their own ignorance and lack of experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because I saw a foolish and experienced doctor make an abscess in the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries in the neck, which caused a large amount of blood to flow until the woman died among her relatives.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who believed that he could pull a stone from a man who was in agony, and the stone was large, but it came out and he cut a piece of the bladder while doing so, due to which the man died three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called for him to extract it, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the patient's condition, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took money from a duke of our land for surgery, and then operated on a black slave who had fractured his thigh; the doctor prepared him with his ignorance, extracted the fracture through an incision, using pulleys and splints with strong construction, but did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	He dressed the wound according to his desires, bandaged it, and left it closed for several days and commanded that we not undress him; until the thigh and leg became abscessed, and led to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and when I undressed the bandages, he found relief from his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But corruption had already been confirmed in the member, so that he could not stop it, and the corruption continued to spread throughout the member until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who made an abscess cancerous and it became ulcerated after several days, until the evil of it was greatly magnified in the lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is because the cancer is pure of melancholic humor, so it does not need to be treated with every remedy, but rather an affected member that receives all its hostility.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my sons, it is necessary for you that surgery of the hand should be divided into two categories: one is associated with health, and the other involves great risk in its execution.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already examined this in every part of this book where there is an operation involving error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to be aware of this and to avoid it, so that the foolish do not deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take up your weapons with caution and protection from God, and your patients with joy and steadfastness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God to achieve salvation and praiseworthy success, and leave behind terrible maladies that are difficult to heal, and abandon your fears, so that you do not waver in your faith or your name: for more remains for your glory, and it will last in this world and beyond your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guidance has already been given in some of its teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat bad disease, so that wicked doctors do not become renowned."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Commence la division du livre et du premier de la première partie.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the feet, in the shapes of instruments and the types of cauteries, as well as what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter is about blisters and perforations, about bleeding and ulcers, and about the extraction of boils and similar afflictions, all categorized and arranged in the shapes of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, as well as the treatment of twists and similar afflictions; the chapter is dedicated to the feet, and organized according to the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	With the use of a cautery heated by fire and with sharp medicine, remember the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Know what the quality of the juxtaposed components of that cautery and its potential disadvantages are, and in which circumstances the use of a cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore say that the discourse on the quality of the component of the cautery and its disadvantages is long, detailed, scientific, and somewhat cryptic; many wise men have spoken about it extensively, and they disagree on the subject, and I shall only touch upon one of their discourses, fearing to prolong the discussion.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore say that cauterization generally concerns all material or materials, with the exception of two cases, which are cases where caution is contraindicated.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of dry and hard matter, there is disagreement; some argue that caution is beneficial in this case, while others argue the opposite, claiming that caution is not appropriate for sickness that is caused by quality and dryness, as nature itself is both quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient to treat a dry and hard affliction with something that is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say this about the one who disagrees with that argument, stating that caution is useful for all dry and hard afflictions found in human bodies, as when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the nature of fire, it overpowers the body of a man.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And say this on behalf of the one who disagrees, that I have tried it in certain situations and found evidence to support his argument.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is essential that we examine this matter in depth, as the one who argues in favor of caution has already been experienced and exercised in the chapter of cauterization in past practice, and he is aware of the diversity of human conditions and the nature of their afflictions, their causes, their manifestations, and the length of time for each.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However, in other cases, it is not a matter of fear, especially for soft and moist afflictions, as all doctors have already agreed on these, and they are not divided on the usefulness of caution in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And sons, understand that the secret of curing with fire and caution lies in cautery combined with medicine, as fire is simple, the action of which only affects the member that is cauterized and does not harm any other member unless there is a small disadvantage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicine burns towards that in the members which it is applied to, and it strongly drives sickness in the afflicted member of difficult healing and strong pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The fire, through its excellence and goodness, does not do this only but rather exceeds it, and it is already known to us by experiment and long study of the art concerning the truth of causes; and therefore I am excused for the length of the sermon, except that it is not lawful for me in this pause to reveal secretly hidden by the fire, and the quality of the operation on the body and its expulsion through which you expel sicknesses, philosophical demonstrative speech, which would serve to sharpen your pains.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to make cauteries and pause in the best time of springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by accidental time is submerged in the advantage of what is attracted by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pain or necessary pain, which do not suffer delay, since it is feared that the one who comes with evil intention is greater than small harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so do not eat in your feet, or sons, that is not valued except by the common people and foolish doctors, because that illness which is cured by cauterization is not always resolved and they delay its outcome.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think for that, because cauterization is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moistures which are the reason for the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nonetheless, cauterization is excessive over the medicine due to its desire for its power and virtue and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the illness may return at some time in the future, depending on the patient's complexion and the location of their illness, as well as its properties, and what is prepared in their body due to the accumulation of superfluidities in them, and what is obtained by them through their diet and similar causes; except that the illness for which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness in parts with few superfluidities and moistures, such as cauterizing teeth for pain and similar, it is possible that in it the pain will not return, but rather a small one.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But the common saying is that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine, and that is incorrect, not according to what I understand in it, because I believe that it is not healing that improves with medicine or any other cause related to cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is the opposite of that; and the intention that cauterization is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the methods of healing in some illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and at the end of the illness, a person is given cauterization, and it improves in it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Here is the correction for the last sentence:
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this for the equality of gold and the exalted nature of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not harm, as that is not absolutely true, because I already have this proven and observed that it does not do so in some bodies and cauterization with it is good and better than iron as they said; but when you perform cauterization with fire from gold, it is not clear to you, because it depends on the amount that you want for its redness, and it prepares to receive friction; and if you adjust above the flame, the gold melts due to the heat of the fire, and in the fire some layers are formed so that the craftsman can cauterize through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore, cauterization with iron should be done gently and then more firmly in order to correct the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have also ordered those of the head within the feet, so that you can lighten your request for it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterizing pain in the head due to coldness and moistness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization provides relief from both coldness and moistness in the affected area, which are two causes of scurvy and excessive flow of mucus, called corrhea, from the head to the parts of the ears and nose fluidity, as well as excessive sleeping, tooth pain and gout, and generally all illnesses that come from coldness, such as paralysis, sclerosis, and similar in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a medicinal laxative for three or four nights, according to the properties of the illness, and their age and their habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then you command him to shave his head with a razor and then he should sit on a chair with his feet resting on your hands.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then you place the edge of your palm approximately at the level of his nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But since your hand position is not yet clear, mark that location with a probe and then apply the olive oil-based cauterizer in this manner:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then you place it there on the indicated location, in such a way that it descends, with your hand moving downwards, and your grip gradually tightens as you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then you lift your hand lightly and observe the location, and if you see some amount of bone emerging from the head, such as the size of a grain of wheat, you raise your hand and if it does not return to its place with that iron, another one of it, if it is cold, until the bone is visible where I told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the location and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a cushion over the wound covered by it, that which should destroy the scar of fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And apply a plaster containing four medications over the affected area until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	When the wound remains open for a long time, let it be treated with honey, as it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They say that the vertebra should be burned with cautery and held until a piece of the bone is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape off that which is attached to the bone, and let it heal.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that with cautery reaching the bone, it should be strongly applied to the bone until the bone breaks, and this is the method of amputation in small places.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate that from that place escape the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	Let the wound remain open for a long time, and apply remedies to heal it until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen both kinds of cautery for all cases, but only in some men out of fear; and leave that one, you should do what is better for health, as the head is more susceptible to solubility due to continuity of this kind, as has been proven in other members, and especially when the patient's head is of free nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is more effective and should be preferred; and that one and that operation are for the sake of health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Chapter of the head cauterization:
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the entire head of a patient, use weapons, scissors, tweezers, plasters, ointments, gauze, needles, liniments, and similar remedies, especially if it has already been cauterized with one cautery that does not help in any of those causes, then consider whether the patient's head is of strong creation by nature; and it is not free and has a large inflammation, then cauterize it again with another cautery after a short time.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that on the corner of the patient's head with cautery until the vertebra is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the vertebra and expose the amount that has been determined and cauterize it with one cautery in the rear part of the head at the location called "vas" - and that is the location where a bladder-like protrusion occurs.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And do not expose the bone, because the patient suffers great pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And say that this cautery is in its place, because the cautery with which the corners of the head and the occiput are cauterized is more subtle than the cautery used for other parts of the head; and this is the method.
Capitol ters.	Chapter third:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Chapter of modern amputation:
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain in the head part swells or pain enters into the skull, it should be evacuated with medicines that alleviate the condition, and the other cure (which I have called remedies for illnesses); but if this does not help, cauterization is performed in two ways: either cauterization with a burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A hot iron tool is taken, sharpened at both ends and applied to the temples of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the location of pain on the temple with a sharp, small knife, but deep enough to create a hollow, yet not visible.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Apply pressure with a cloth on the previously constricted area and leave it for three hours; then remove the linen, and let the plaster remain for two or three days, and place a bandage over the submerged area until the wound heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Cure that (the wound) with mouth rinses until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do so with some burning medicines that I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Cauterization with iron follows this method: the form of fire used for cauterization is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a clamp nail, because the head of it is shaped like a nail with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small protuberance.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Place your hand over the location of pain, and hold it - so as not to injure the archery which is below - and turn the small iron slowly with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the quantity that is injured by the tip of the knife is not too much and the hand is raised to prevent the artery which is below from being injured, so that there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Apply cotton to the area in salt water and let it stay there for three days; then bandage the area with linen, and cure it with mouth rinses until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	If you wish, cauterize the end of the scythe with caution, and be careful not to make an incision in the artery in this new method which is not traditional.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the ancient method of cauterization for migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migraines with the remedies mentioned in the previous cure and in the remedies for illnesses, and the cure does not work, or when the disease is not cured by the first cauterization with burning medicine or cauterization with fire, then it becomes necessary to ignite the scythe cautery before it turns white (meaning place a line of long length over the location of pain, the thickness of which is the width of the finger, or whatever that may be); and after waiting a while, press down on it and make an incision in the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to damage the jawbone, which is detrimental to chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves which support that, and that it does not result in spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of bleeding from the artery that is cut, because in cutting there is fear, and especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not learned or experienced; and let the operation begin at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	I will remember the regulation of bleeding from an accident of the artery according to its method, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that is not cured by this cauterization and if you find the patient's body tolerable, cauterize it in the middle of the head as mentioned earlier, and cure the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	If you wish, administer the cauterization that was mentioned in the chapter on compression of the artery with cauterization using two knives, and this is the best and most suitable cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear occurs due to cold and is treated with cooling causes and the other cure (which was mentioned in the division) does not alleviate the pain, then apply fire, which is called puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Place the puncta in the fire and bring it to the environment of the entire ear like a wheel that is rolled, or in the vicinity of each example if the pain is in one place.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Approach the ear with the cauterizing tool of the razor little by little, but with caution so as not to injure the location you are trying to reach.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of all the points is throughout the entire area, and that which is affected heals, then care for the areas within until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	If the cautery of all the points is applied throughout the whole region, and what has been affected heals, then attend to the areas affected until they are healed (or cured).
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Treatise on Cauterization of Gout.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Gout, which is cured by cauterization, is not other than the species that comes from arrows, as it has been said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterizing the species that enter through dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of gout with herbs and purges and ointments, and do not find relief from your treatment, then you must necessarily cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first one must be made at the region, the second one a little lower near the temple, and the third one should join the edges of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place the cautery against the affected part in a manner contrary to the direction of the illness, for relief is not found except at the point where it heals.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The manner of cauterization is to cauterize that part with the cautery in the direction of the end of the affected area, and then a little above the ear, and at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger, and after placing your hand with the cautery over the affected area until it has been burned to the extent that the quantity of the affected part has been consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the shape of the cautery, and it is the type of knife, whose shape is flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, because it must be very sharp, you should not leave too much excess coarseness on it; it is necessary to grind it in the place of excessive coarseness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Care for the area with what is before processing until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Treatise on Cauterization of Burns.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the Cauterization of Ancient Apoplexy
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When ancient apoplexy occurs and the treatment for it has been described but not followed, and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: primarily on all the corners of his head; and in the middle of his head, as mentioned; and in his neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method for cauterization is done as previously described.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	It has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; it is more posterior; and it should be cured with what is appropriate.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the Cauterization of Forgetfulness Caused by Fever.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	The patient should be given large pills at the beginning, which will help to purify him.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's entire head and place an ointment on his neck as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Leave it for several days, because this is the method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do as ordered by that medicine, which has already been mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	If it cures well in this manner, then do nothing more; but if not, perform three cauterizations on the lower part of his head, which should descend from the most superior part of his head to the lower part of his neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Leave a gap between each cauterization and care for the cauterized area with what is appropriate.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you wish to be more daring and the patient is tolerant of it, then cauterize in the middle; but if you want even more, then cauterize it on both corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Care for the cauterized area until it is healed and the cauterizations are olive-shaped, as previously described.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the Cauterization of Paralysis and the Softening of the Whole Body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Treat the head with pills and what has been mentioned previously; then shave the patient's head, cauterize it in the middle of his head, on all corners of his head, on the lower part of his head, and three cauterizations on the spinal vertebrae of his neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for the softening of the body in cases of dropsy and the patient is tolerant and the disease is strong, then cauterize it with four cauterizations on the spine of the back, and later a cauterization to burn through the thick skin, and raise your hand above it.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Care for the cauterized area until it is healed and the cauterizations are olive-shaped.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the Cauterization of Epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Epilepsy itself is not cauterized, but that epilepsy caused by fever is.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, you should purify the brain of the patient at the beginning with herbs and the other treatment mentioned in the division when the patient is strong and tolerates the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who does not tolerate medications, administer gurgles and teething remedies to help purify him for several days with good food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head and cauterize it in the middle of his head according to the previous method, and another cauterization on the back of his head, and one on each corner of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize it with cauterizations as described (paralysis and softening of the body on the spinal vertebrae of the neck and back).
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	The cauterizations should be olive-shaped, as previously mentioned.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, pause with subtle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the Cauterization of Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and a severe fever, cauterize it with the cauterizations as described in the paralysis division.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluidity that declines into melancholy and the body of the patient is moist, give him what purifies his brain according to what has been described in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, make a tourniquet around it, and leave it in place on his forehead.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	The patient should be completely undressed and held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	A balm is applied; it is more appropriate to use an ancient sheep balm.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat it over the fire at a moderate temperature, which he will endure when it is placed on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Place it on his forehead in the circle and leave it until it is absorbed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And perform this procedure on the patient every week, accompanied by the proper regimen until they are well; or if you wish, cauterize it by making small points according to what is most necessary, unless you have a cautery of this kind prepared: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain with equal proportion.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then pause that sore in bandaging or in gray plaster of Paris.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of water descending in the bladder.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have recognized the onset of water in the bladder by the signs I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient a drink that purifies their head, and keep them away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make him soak in bath with alum for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head, and cauterize that spot on the head with a cautery in the middle of the head; and cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if there is the beginning of urinary discharge from two bladders, or one cauterization if it is the beginning of water in one bladder.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make an incision with a cautery on all the veins and arteries that are underneath the coccyx; and make the cauterizations in that long area at the level of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful to prevent bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see any bleeding, stop it with some medicine that is within your ability.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with knowledge concerning the extraction of arteries, the incision of them, and caution regarding bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck on both sides with two cauterizations at the lower part of the neck.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the bladders are old and persistently caused by veins and arteries manifest in the place of the head outside, and it is verified that it is excessive fluid, then cauterize that with the cautery as mentioned in the chapter on urinary discharge in the bladders, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and two cauterizations at both temples, and two cauterizations at both neck bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it requires addition, then cauterize that on the entire length of the bladder at the tip of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nose smell (nasal stench).
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that which I have mentioned in the division and your treatment does not improve, then prepare yourself and give the patient chamomile tea for three nights; shave their head, and cauterize it with a medium-sized cautery using olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize that on the eyelashes with carnation cautery and two cauteries on both eyebrows above the small hairs.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to cut any arteries when doing so.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	The form of the carnation cautery is as follows.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the softening of eyelids from the bladder.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the bladder is softened by disease or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery. And here is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are performing the cauterization, do it on both eyebrows with a small cautery and two cauterizations in every section, extending from one temple to the other.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	Let each cauterization be as long as the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to the thickness of the section of the eyelid that is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of the eyelid of the bladder when the hair has turned into the sections and the bladder is hardened.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the bladder has turned into the sections and pierces the bladder, cauterize in those areas using two methods: cauterization can be done with heat or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If a heated cautery is applied to the affected area, tell the patient to lower their pants as they do when washing themselves, until it is prolonged and bound; and if you puncture that area, then bind it with a bandage so that it does not become infected until the skin heals.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then raise the head of the patient and hold your hand over the eyelids of their wounds with a cloth bearing the symbol of the fern leaf, starting from the skin area.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then apply warm oil or chicken broth on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And bring the heated cautery with this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize the area marked by the symbol, little by little, with observed burn marks, until the surface of the skin is burned like fern leaves, completely apparent.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of healing from your work is that the eyelid of the wound is contracted and the skin around it raised after the puncture of the wound.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore raise your hand and leave it there for three days, then cover the area with stitches until the scar has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then care for it until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the skin around it returns for any cause and the eyelid becomes soft, then apply the heated cautery to it again in the same manner as before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the skin is on the eyelid and it drops down, then cauterize it so that it returns to its original position, closes, and the skin does not puncture the wound again.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If the cautery with medicine is burning this means that you should tell the patient to lower their pants until it is prolonged and bound, and prepare a paper or cloth in the shape of a fern leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take known sage and fresh cow's urine. .i., And mix these ingredients well, and do it with haste so that it is not spoiled; then spread this mixture over the cloth shaped like a fern leaf, placing it on one or both of the wounds; then cover the wound area with warm oil, and place the patient's head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then place the patient on the medicine and press it gently so that they do not move until they feel the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Therefore, when the patient perceives that the herb is biting them, remove the medicine and cover it with your hand; therefore, when the bite ceases, remove the medicine and wash the wound with water; then consider if the eyelid has been lifted like it should be washed with fire or cut, for this is good; and if it does not return to its place after being removed from the medicine on the area where there was no pressure applied, then put the medicine back over that spot until your operation is complete and the wound is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then cover the area with stitches until the skin of the adhesion is removed, and care for it until the adhesion is completely healed or until it is treated with another method.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to keep a close watch during your operation so that no pus from the wound drips onto the medicine; if after several days the eyelid becomes soft and some skin around it punctures the wound, then repeat your treatment over the affected area in the same manner as at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the form of the mastic tree leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You should know that men's hernias are of various sizes and shapes, so accordingly make your treatment.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the path of right direction to him who has studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula which is in the eyelid hernia.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as I have said in the division of diseases and do not make your treatment, then you must cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to put his head in your lap, and let some servant hold his head between yours in such a way that he is neither harmed nor agitated by his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place a piece of cotton soaked in oil or bird glue on the hernia of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And approach the cauterizing instrument which has this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is hollow, as is the form of a reed or a feather quill, from one end of which the cauterizing tool is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	If you wish, enter it into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, withdraw it thus.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the hollow one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And place your hand on the cauterizing instrument which is well ignited, and you with your other hand should hold the cauterizing tool at the edge of the nose, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed, and then press the cauterizing tool on the hernia and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if the cauterization reaches the bone at first, that is good; otherwise, you should make the cauterization once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then press on that spot with a linen cloth and cover it with a dry dressing until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if it has passed ten days and is not healed, then press on it with a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and scraped as needed according to its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	Another method of cauterizing a fistula which some people have said is: enter the location of the fistula and close it, then place a fine thread in that fissure, which has the form of a needle: And the quantity of the lead was one inch melted; and you with your hand hold the needle well, so as not to harm the patient because the molten lead should not reach the hernia of him; and it is necessary that you press on the hernia of the patient with cotton soaked in oil or water, for the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by miraculous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by the cauterization and treatment that I have said, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer nose drops and reduce the fistula into the nose as appropriate in its location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the fissure of the head.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Most often, fissures occur in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures as I have said in the division and your treatment is not successful, then ignite a small, sharp scissors-shaped cauterizing instrument according to this form:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the concavity of it according to the fineness of the scissors.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Press that edge carefully into those fissures until the cauterizing tool reaches the root of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And treat it with a kerocote until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	If in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth a pustule is formed and a boil is made, and it breaks, and it becomes old, and it makes a fistula, and you treat it and your treatment is not successful, then it is necessary that you ignite a cauterizing instrument according to the quantity received in the fistula, and then place the ignited tool in the fistula hole, and with your hand bring it to the root of him, and at the end do this once or twice; and treat it with what I have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the pus is drained and healed, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to expose the location and scrape the rotten bone according to its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Treatment of cauterization of teeth and softening of ulcers.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When ulcers are softened by moisture and teeth are damaged, and you cannot heal them with medicine, then place the patient's head on your lap, bring the cautery near that is suitable for this purpose, ensure the patient can feel the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and move the heated cautery several times according to your will.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient rinses their mouth with salt water and holds it for an hour, then stop it because the damaged tooth is closed, the swollen gum is tightened, and the corrupt moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Treatment of tooth pain by cauterization.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by inflammation or worms, or medicine does not heal it, then cauterize the area in two ways: either with a cowhorn cautery, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	A cowhorn cautery is obtained by taking a cow's horn and heating it in an iron pot, then selecting a small piece of the heated horn and wrapping it in linen cloth, immersing it in water, and placing it on the painful tooth quickly until it becomes hot.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then move the heated horn cautery several times until the heat reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you wish, immerse linen or a piece of cloth in the hot horn cautery, place it on the painful tooth, and hold it there until the heated iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization by fire method has the drawback that you must be careful with the coal or iron, and there should not be any large protrusions in the area to prevent the heat of the fire from reaching the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery in a suitable manner, and place it on the tooth until it becomes hot, and do this several times as needed to alleviate the pain either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary to use pressure on the cautery so that the patient holds their mouth open with a good bite and keeps it there for an hour, then spit it out. This is the method of using the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize only the affected area as much as is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the cannula (a hollow tube used for medical procedures):
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Treatment of hernias by cauterization.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are caused by inflammation and cold humors that do not respond to medicine and you want to treat them gently, then heat the cautery in a suitable manner (as described below), holding both ends so that the smoke escapes through one end, and apply the heated cauterizer to the abscess for a moment. If necessary, repeat this process until it reaches the base of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the abscess is small, then pause the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and apply the linen for three days on it, and pause over the affected area until the fluid inside has been completely burned by the fire.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Approach it with warm cloths and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the syringe or the cautery should be suitable for this purpose.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of throat warts and constriction of veins.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes upon the trachea of the lung, and especially when it is accompanied by inflammation, it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at first with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that affected place at the location of the goiter.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to burn the goiter with the cautery or burn its surrounding tissue, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize that affected place at another joint of the neck on the lower spine.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery used should be sharp, following the previous method.
