Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	If the fracture is in one of the other knuckles (such as the middle finger joint, index finger joint, ring finger joint, or little finger joint), bind it and apply the necessary splint to immobilize it; or use a continuous bandage for the entire length of the finger, which is better; or use a small probe on top of it, as described in the case of the push fracture.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	In your healing process, also consider the appearance of an abscess and its opposite (opposition) using the appropriate procedure, as well as what is necessary when any of these occurrences happen, according to the narrative provided.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	This is the title of the chapter. It translates to "On the healing of a hip bone fracture."
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	A broken and dislocated hipbone is identified by its appearance, which resembles the part above and above the pubic bone.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	The restoration (of the patient) is done in such a way that the plaster (or bandage) is strengthened over the fracture and another plaster removed from the fracture, and the patient is prostrate on their stomach and face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	Then extend the entire plaster to its limit according to its quality, when the fracture is in the middle of the bone. (Note: "liament" refers to the plaster or bandage used for healing.)
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is necessary to reduce the swelling of the thigh, then the plaster should be close to the edge at the end of the thigh, so that its extension covers it, and another plaster removed from the fracture. (Note: "pentenilh" refers to the thigh bone or femur.)
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	Similarly, if the fracture is close to the edge, then make the plaster close to the edge and extend it to the sides. (Note: This suggests that when the fracture is near the end of a bone, the plaster should be placed closer to the end and extended further out to provide support.)
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	Then the doctor should put both hands inside and reduce the bone according to its natural shape, so that it is joined well; at this point, you must stop plastering and applying tight bandages, unless there is an abscess in the limb. (Note: This suggests that the doctor should manipulate the broken bone back into its correct position before applying a plaster or bandage, but if there is an infection present, they should not apply the plaster or bandage to prevent further spread of the infection.)
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if there is an abscess, leave it for several days until the abscess subsides, and then return to your care. (Note: This suggests that if there is an infection present, they should not apply the plaster or bandage immediately but wait for the infection to subside before continuing treatment.)
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The bandaging should be done in this way: you must wrap a hard bandage around the fracture, fold it over two or three times, and remove any excess; then wrap the leg and the swelling of the thigh. (Note: This suggests that the hard bandage should be tightly wrapped around the fracture site and the affected limb to provide support and prevent movement.)
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	Insert a long iron rod between the thigh and the leg near the edge on both sides, and bring the ends of the rod from above both sides, and then turn it around the leg and thigh so that any excess bandage wraps over it. (Note: This suggests that an iron rod should be inserted between the thigh and the leg to provide additional support during treatment.)
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	Place a splint on the thigh at the location of the fracture, and place another splint over the bone of the leg. (Note: This suggests that a splint should be used to immobilize the affected limb during treatment.)
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	Fill the void between the leg and thigh with soft cloths, so that the bleeding stops. (Note: This suggests that the affected area should be filled with soft cloths to stop any bleeding or oozing of fluid.)
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	Begin with a strong bandage over the location of the fracture with three or four layers, and as you approach the plaster at the site of the fracture, your bandaging should be less tight and more loose and moist. (Note: This suggests that the affected area should be tightly wrapped initially, but as the plaster approaches the fracture site, it should be loosened to allow for swelling and healing.)
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	Extend the iron rod to both ends of the leg on both sides as far as it reaches the ankle of the foot, and tighten both ends of the splints of the other limb so that the plaster does not move from its position. (Note: This suggests that the affected limb should be immobilized with splints at both ends to prevent movement during treatment.)
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	Leave the bandaging in this way so that it does not cause corrosion, abscess, or inflammation and resembles those; if any of these occurrences happen, then remove the plaster immediately, and correct everything appropriately, according to what has been said previously. (Note: This suggests that the bandage should be applied in a way that does not cause infection or inflammation, and if any complications arise, they should be addressed immediately.)
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a bone tumor present, you must remove it as much as possible; and if it cannot be completely removed, cut off the surrounding area, and treat with what was previously mentioned until it heals. (Note: This suggests that if there is a tumor in the bone, it should be removed as much as possible, but if complete removal is not possible, the affected area should be surgically excised and treated.)
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	Some weeks are stronger than this thigh fracture, as mentioned in the advice and in the arm. (Note: This suggests that the healing process for certain types of fractures, such as those in the thigh or arm, may take longer than others.)
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, in the restoration of this type, the patient should not experience limping; if it is only restored, and another limb is not applied, then limping is necessary for the one that is always used. (Note: This suggests that in some cases, a patient may need to use crutches or a walking aid on their unaffected leg to compensate for the immobilized affected limb during recovery.)
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	You should know that the illness [gout] lasts for 40 days or a little more or a little less, and all this is according to the diversity of complications and other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	The following lines seem to belong to a different section of the text, perhaps another capital (section) in the treatise:
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	The following lines seem to belong to a different section of the text, perhaps another capital (section) in the treatise:
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	The following lines appear to belong to the same section as the previous translation:
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	If the fracture occurs, it is not only a break but also a tear in the bone parts, and this is a plague or multiple plagues, and over all this the pain is felt.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	The restoration of the bone is such that it must be brought together so that what has been broken from its parts is joined and aligned as much as possible by means of traction, padding, and fabrication (or splinting).
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	Then place a plaster (or bandage) and apply it over the round stone (if necessary); and press firmly with a strap (or bandage) around it (as appropriate).
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	Then consider all the dispositions that have been recommended in other fractures, such as the use of an apotemum (an ointment or salve) and similar substances that may be applied to prevent infection and promote healing at the site of the fracture until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	The following lines appear to be a new section heading in the text:
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	The following lines appear to belong to a different section of the text:
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	The following lines appear to belong to the same section as the previous translation:
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	It happens to some of the species of fracture that it happens to the two bones of the arm, and for this reason, restoration is made in this way as the restoration of the arm, and the operation of it is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	If two bones are broken together, the cavity becomes completely divided.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	If the bone is broken finely, the cavity becomes partially divided in front.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	If the bone is broken coarsely, it breaks that one off, and this is due to one of the causes not being alleviated.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	Then administer extension, alignment, and ligature of the splinters as per that method.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	However, it is important if the fracture of the cavity has many complications, that the extension be smaller and more gentle, and alleviate with your power.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	In the cavity is some cause for operation on the arm, and this occurs when you plug the splinters and complete all the procedure, then you will take pieces of pine wood that are placed at the causes that have been treated on soles, and these are made in the same way with palm branches; align them according to small roughness, and they should not be jagged, and their length according to the length of the cavity, and from the neck to the wrist.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	Then wrap each piece of cloth in two layers according to its length, and place one on the division of the cavity of one side and the other on the other side, and they should be from the neck to the wrist of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	Then bind the two splinters in three places of both ends and at the middle location, because with this structure the cavity is prevented from closing on the left and right side, and this is good positioning.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	A brace of wood has already been administered according to the length of the cavity, and it should be placed there to prevent movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	Moreover, you must do this in a fracture, and when that is truly a wound.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then consider the fracture every day and study it more deeply, and you must protect it from abscess and inflammation or other similar causes; and when any cause of those occurs, then you oppose yourself to it until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the heel and the bones of the foot and toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	Not every heel suffers from fracture; but some bones of the foot suffer fracture; and in the toes only occasional fractures occur, and they do not occur except by excessive movement.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	If the bones of the foot break and sometimes those bones rise up between them, then the patient should rest his foot on the ground prepared in this way (as with a splint).
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	Then place one foot on that which is raised from those bones, and press, bind, and hold it in place until it returns to its original position.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	Then apply a plaster and stopper on top of it, and place under the foot a small table with two flat heads.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And strengthen it with the foot in the correct position, because you have wrapped it with cloth and other causes for which it is necessary.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you remove the ligament because you will find the bones bound, or broken or dislocated, and the operation in these is done in the same way as we mentioned above.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	However, if some toes are broken, then you restore them, bind them in the same way as I recommend to you in the restoration of fingers on the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place the broken toe splinter according to the length of the toe, and it should be slightly curved inward; and under the foot place this table that I have recommended to you, and strengthen it with correct positioning.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	However, if the fracture of the bones is two or three or more, then you place a splint according to the size of each toe wrapped in linen cloth on each toe, and strengthen the table under the heel of the foot, and stand it on one of the heads of the table so that it holds well.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is important for you to remember that you do not forget all the causes mentioned to you in other fractures due to accidents we have mentioned; and oppose yourself to all accidents that are necessary.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the hump of the woman and the bone of the pubic arch and the buttock of the man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the hump of the woman is broken, you let it heal in a hanging position, and incline it to the opposite side slightly, and hold it behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And the midwife fills the hump with cotton, and it should be done in the hump in this way as expected; and the woman is shaken, and the hips are raised slightly, because all this is forgotten until it comes forward to the opposite side of the hump as expected and the broken bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	Then place powder on the hips, and when it is time to urinate, remove the cottons with ease and urinate, then reduce and return it in the same way as you placed it at the beginning, and then return the powder first.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	Make an opening in this manner for seven days or around that time, as it will be restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	If you wish, take an ovine bladder and force a canal made of reed through it; insert the entire bladder into the cavity and inflate the canal with air until the bladder is distended within the cavity, as the fracture will return.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	Then fill it with cotton and leave it in place for several days as prescribed until it heals.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bones of the pelvis in males or females are fractured, administer in their restoration and treatment of the hip bone what has been prescribed for the bone of the pelvis.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	That which is right should not be hidden in these nearby fractures and that do not require much effort, especially to one who has some knowledge, study, use, and understanding of this book; for that fracture indicates to you the greatest dispositions towards righteousness in their restoration and stricture, therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the case of the male's broken tailbone, take guarguamela root and place it on the fracture; then cover it with cloth and wrap it up, let it rest for three days or around that time, and it will heal.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of restoration of bone fractures when infected.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is appropriate for one who has suffered a fracture with infection, and especially if the bone is large like that of the thigh or shoulder, or similar to it, that you cauterize and probe it as soon as the conditions for cauterization or probing are present as stated above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the infection discharges pus, you must take measures to retain it until you pulverize gold dust over it, unless there is another reason.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	Then begin the restoration of the fracture on that day, and do not delay it, unless an abscess occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess occurs cauterized, you must let the restoration wait for up to nine days until the abscess subsides, and do not approach it on the third and fourth day and thereafter, as you will cause harm.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent above the skin exposed, you must perforate it and reduce the fracture with your hands with ease and minimal extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if the extension is not prepared and the situation with your hands, you must reduce it with these tools; this tool is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight fingers, and the width according to the size of the infection; and this is necessary for the physician who will take three or four according to the amount required in the treatment of all types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And be round, and be slightly coarse in size to avoid the compression of the fracture during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And be of sharp edges with a margin at the ends; the upper end should be thicker and from the middle towards the fractures.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	It is called "labre voluntary pallet" in Greek, so it is a small flat piece of bone.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Therefore the end of it must be placed slightly elevated above the end of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	Insert it once into a wound until the bone is reduced and set properly.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	Therefore force the fracture ends together, and if the broken end is thin, do not use the tool for good reason, but you must insert the end of the bone until the tool can grip it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone with what has been prescribed, then insert it using what is necessary for the chisels which we have mentioned, or it can be with one of the saws in any way that is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	Then remove that part which remains rough and full of small splinters.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	When the bone has been reduced and the patient experiences intense pain quickly, you must understand that the bone has not returned to its natural location; and thus do what will give great benefit to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration of the bone is complete and you have placed a black stiptic cloth over it, do not apply any oil to the infection or other cause in which there is ointment, as this will cause putridity and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	Approximately administer stitches at the time of your completion of the bone's restoration, and leave the wound exposed only as much as necessary, to incise it with forceps and use bandages according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	Be careful not to stretch the wound with force, for many times ignorant physicians have caused death or severe illness or amputation in their patients, as this leads to healing.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	If the patient's wound is loose, soft and different from the strictures of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	If the wound is large or bad and you fear the risk of a bad outcome, and pain occurs at the site, it is not necessary to place stitches there, but rather apply a hard bandage in place of stitches and tighten it with that.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	When the wound begins about one or two days later, which is caused by a blow, then remove the cloth that you had placed on it and apply warm compresses, as it is our custom to treat wounds, such as warm compresses like tetrapotassium and similar ones.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	It is necessary for you to remove the bandage and examine the wound every morning and evening until it is consolidated and healed, and it is important that the limb is prepared in such a way that the purulence flows from it to the joints nearby with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the wound persists for many days and is not consolidated or does not abscess from the blow, then you must realize that this is a complication of the small vessels, so examine the wound with care.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	If those complications that are separated and extracted do not occur, and those that are not separated and place the limb and cause pain, then you must incise them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	If the wound becomes gangrenous or rotten, this is a symptom or another type of corruption and putrefaction, then it is necessary to place a poultice on one of them according to what is appropriate for its healing, which is preceded by a narrative in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding what needs the most attention and you present your case: when large bones are broken, raise the limb in the same way as the bones of the thigh and similar ones of large members, without presuming traction or extraction of it, for many times this leads to death; leave it inside until it can be moved, for a strong limb may fall apart within two to thirty days. And you take care of the wound if you have seen it, and do not leave it untreated.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX:
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of a node that occurs in the trace of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	This node often occurs in the trace of healing from a fracture, and more frequently near joints, and it is caused by the figure of the limb; strong limbs prohibit their natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore consider whether the node is recent and administer medications that have astringent properties such as alum, tannins, and others; take some or all of these, and compress them with vi stiptic or album of huou or other astringents, and place it on the node in a cloth, and press it firmly around it for good compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	Leave the extraction that does not loosen it for many days; and remove it after the node is gone; or press firmly on a lead sheet tightly, as lead has the property of holding everything that is inflated in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the node has become hard and tight and necessitates removing it constantly, then you should cut it along the most superior part of it, and excise the excess and protruding portions or remove it with forceps until it is gone; and take care of it until it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI:
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	In restoration of a fracture, when it is restored and remains limb subtle and free following its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of the bone is restored, and it remains limb subtle and free, it does not happen except for multiple causes: one of which is an excess of solution of the ligament and the ligature made not according to what is needed; or due to superfluity of tightness of the ligaments before nutriment is prohibited from running to the member; or due to excessive embrocaccio [a type of bandaging or splinting]; or due to movement superfluent not in its time; or due to small amount of blood in the patient's body and debility.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the cure of this is to feed the patient and make their heart tender before the blood is multiplied in them, and administer baths, and give warm and sweet food and comfort over him/her.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	Then place plaster on the limb, so that the plaster draws to it the nourishment, or continue the bandaging of him/her with warm water, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the cure of broken bones when they are restored crookedly and the operation on them is forbidden what is necessary.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When a limb that has been restored appears to lack healing of its crookedness and prominence at the broken bone and nodule, and it is due to the shape of the member, but the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, then you should take the word of the one who states that the limb was newly fractured.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there are many foolish doctors and restorers who have done this in our land, and this operation is greatly to be condemned as leading to great fear of the sign of which death is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the limpness and nodule are recent, then it is necessary that they be bandaged with warm water in which are placed soft herbs soothing, such as althea leaves and razor roots, and mellilot, and similar to these; and it should be made into a plaster with plaster of mollicificatio, or the mucillage of razor root althea is prepared and rubbed with the gray of gualina or oil of camphor, and it is plastered with that; or the figs are soaked in oil and crushed with the pomegranate seeds, and similar to these of the medicines called amermans consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved by persistent light friction that is with the most humid, and movement of the member should be administered in all parts at all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if crookedness has already advanced far and is made strong and turned into stone and necessitated cure of it by iron, then it is necessary that the pus above be cauterized and the continuation of the bone be dissolved, and what superfluous of nodule in it should be removed with fine cutters and administered ease to him/her with solicitude and care.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On the speech on dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is essentially of one of the joints of its place, which is forbidden to move, and distorts the shape of the limb, and brings pain and great injuries upon the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore when an accident occurs with a dislocation, it is necessary to do so immediately and not delay the reduction, for if it is delayed, the joint becomes necrotic and difficult reduction of dislocation becomes very difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, it is not good nor stretched out at the time of the necrosis, because many times brings spasms and slow pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this occurs, it is necessary that you take the flap of the patient's skin, and let it be cauterized before the necrosis subsides; and the limb should be bandaged with warm water and oil, and the reduction should be made with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all the member should be healed by the means that will come in its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have now and ordered the chapters of dislocation as it was before in the fracture; from the upper division of the body to the lower part of it.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the cure of dislocation of the jaw below.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If both jaws are dislocated and not straightened; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: either they are brought back to their places with little movement and softened a bit; or they are completely dislocated and closed, until they are mollified at the juncture until the saliva of the patient flows and he/she cannot keep it nor close his/her mouth, and the tongue of him/her is enveloped in its socket.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But if the dislocation of it is slight, then with the greatest care it should be returned to its place by itself when there is little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is complete and closed, it is necessary that reduction of it be administered gently, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the attendant should hold the head of the patient, and enter his/her thumb into the root of the dislocation of the jaw within the mouth if the dislocation is of one part; or that he/she enters both thumbs together, if the dislocation is of two parts, and the others should be outside with which he/she guides it; and commands the patient to cease his/her jaws and release them from going in any direction; and the doctor should guide the jaw and cover the jaw with a piece of cloth until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	If the reduction is difficult, especially when both mandibles are dislocated, then administer an emulsified solution of hot water and oil until it becomes easy to reduce both, and do not delay the reduction of both for too long, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they have been returned and closed, the mouth of the patient is closed and not softened, then place it on those small pieces of woolen cloth with chalk, make it from beeswax and rubbed oil; and apply it gently to facilitate and loosen the closing.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	The patient should sleep on their back, with the head placed between two pillows to prevent it from turning to either side; do not force any cause of nausea upon them; when their pain is reduced and the mandibles are in place, then you may move them as desired.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	This should be administered gently and not force the opening of the mouth; you must maintain their food and drink, and rest until the mandible is set and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	If the reduction of both mandibles, when they are dislocated at any time and not returned to their places, is difficult, then observe carefully for fevers and constant sweating, and it is strong to provoke vomiting with pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, you should know it is a disaster; and carefully observe that the one to whom this happens will die within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the clavicle and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The clavicle is not dislocated from the inside through its continuity with the breastbone; and sometimes it is dislocated on the outside, which can be determined by examination.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	The restoration of this is that the patient lies on their back and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then compress the area with your hand with strong compression, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And place a plaster and small pieces of cloth over it, and firmly apply pressure to that area.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	However, if the end of that which is connected to it is not dislocated at any time, it should be reduced and closed as we have said and as you are equipped.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And place that plaster, small pieces of cloth and bandage over it, and command the patient to rest in quiet until healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	This method of treatment reduces the end of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocation in the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that a muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated from the armpit to the lower side.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated above the muscle, but this is rare; and it is not dislocated at the back of the shoulder; and it is not dislocated in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	Furthermore, it is dislocated and protrudes at the lower sides of the armpits, especially in those with little flesh, it is easily dislocated; but in those with much flesh, it protrudes outwardly with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And a strong blow or fall can cause it to occur in some men, and the muscle of that person is cut off by cauterization, and treated with what has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, you should examine this carefully before proceeding with treatment.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	The dislocation of this is known when it occurs at the lower sides of the armpits; therefore you should distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the undamaged one, for there are clear signs of difference; and examine the head of the muscle for a concavity on top and the touch of its head at the end of the armpit like a hump, and when the patient cannot reduce their hand to their elbow or move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated toward the breastbone or inwardly, you should examine it carefully and not be misled.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	The reduction of this dislocation is easy when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	The reduction of this is that the attendant raises the hand to the upper sides, and holds their hands at the lower end of the dislocation, and raises the joint upward with strength to its place, and the attendant raises the hand, and extends it upwards, and holds it there because it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	However, if it does not return by the method we have described, and the dislocation has just occurred, wait several days, and then the patient should be bathed in hot water and embrocation made of marshmallow, fenugreek, and melilotus in water, and administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And the patient should be placed on their back and held at the lower end of the dislocation with a cloth that is neither too loose nor too tight, and the doctor should place his foot on the shoulder, lift the head of the muscle upward, pull the hand of the patient toward the upper sides so it is not displaced again, and another attendant should hold the head of the patient, who should not be displaced toward the lower sides, as it will soon return to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce [the hernia] in this manner: it is that you make a man present who is taller than the patient, and he stands on the side of the affected one, enters his muscle underneath and tickles the patient's hernia, lifting it towards the incision above until the patient is suspended in the air, and another servant pulls the patient's hand from below his abdomen.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the patient is lightweight, then it is necessary that the one who causes it be suspended, so that gravity helps, because the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	It is reduced in the same way by another method: it is that a long pole with its head rounded like the shape of a mortar pestle, neither too thick nor too thin, is placed next to the patient; then, fabric cloth lions are placed on top of the pole's head, and the patient stands according to the length of the pole, with his hand extended on one side and the other person extends his body from the opposite side with force, because the joint returns quickly to its place.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	If the reduction is difficult due to all the reasons mentioned earlier, then use this cure: it is that you take a pole whose length is two forearms and its width four fingers, and its thickness is relieved at the end of the tip in this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	Fabric cloth lions are placed over the rounded head to avoid hurting the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	The tip is placed next to the patient's hernia and his hand or arm is extended over the pole towards the opposite side, and the pole is tied with ropes to the helper and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	The arm is placed on a step of stairs according to its width, and the hand is extended towards the opposite side, while the other body is suspended from the other side, because the joint will return quickly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	Once the intestine is inserted as completely as possible in any manner that is available to you, then it is necessary that you place a linen bandage around the hernia; and apply a plaster prepared with powder of milled alum on top of the muscle, so that it is rolled over, and apply strong pressure below the hernia with a strap; and the ligament is wrapped around the plaster, and the patient's hand is connected to his neck, and it is left, and no damage should be done to the patient's hand for 7 days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	It is necessary that the food of the patient be reduced, until the member is comfortable, because it helps the healing process more quickly.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And give less food for 7 or 5 days and exercise movement; and if it is closed and not softened, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated several times due to humidity that occurs in it or for some other reason, then in that case, cautery with three strokes should be administered, as previously mentioned in the chapter on cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all of this is done and the ligament is removed after 7 days and the joint is not closed, and the plaster and strap are reduced on it several times, but it is still not closed, and the catheter cannot raise the arm above the incision, then you know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, have already been severed or extended or softened, and you should understand that the joint will never be able to return to its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	The dislocation of that one is caused by the feet and the breast or the hips behind it, the reduction is done with a push and extension to the maximum until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Another strap should be administered in that one, and care for it until it heals.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	If there is gravity or delay in the member's healing or movement, then the patient should use hot baths several times until the gravity is relieved and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; it can be dislocated in all directions, but most commonly in front of the back, and the dislocation of it is not relieved by any position or touch according to a certain shape, and when you adjust the displaced shoulder correctly, it is clearly manifested that the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch it with its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you must catch it, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it becomes an abscess cauterized, because if it reaches a cauterized abscess, reducing it is difficult, and recovery is incomplete; moreover, when it occurs at the back, it is worse for all other types of dislocations, and more painful, and more often leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	The restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of it is extended with both arms, and the arm is stretched out, and the hands of the doctor are on the shoulder and below it, and he pushes the joint with his fingers or the blade of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in front, it returns by bending the arm with its own hand until it hits the shoulder with the blade of the palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	If the dislocation does not yield to reduction, then administer vigorous extension and strong motion.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And that two servants extend the arms, and let them have the same position so that there is no resistance to the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Approach the arm should be rolled up entirely, as it is wrapped in long doubled cloth around its hand or bandaged.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	When the doctor touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil to help alleviate the cause of pain and increase lubrication in the joint, then approach and push the joint firmly until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Then the reduction should be stopped on that plaster where there is stiffness and hardness with albumen of egg, and it should be extracted with a descending force, the arm should be suspended from the neck, and left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then it should be loosened; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you remove the bandage from there and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	If the joint is not strong, you should loosen the plaster and bandage, leave it for some days until it is extracted, then remove it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if there is gravity in the reduction of the joint and its position is moving, administer humectation in bathing and gentle friction, and compression, until it is alleviated; or rest on the joint for a few days, so that it can heal itself; then tie it up and leave it on the bones for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	Then remove it and put it in the bath; when it becomes warm, you should massage the joint with tempered friction, and then re-apply it, which is a movement of the roller, once, twice, and thrice,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has occurred inside the denouement, until it is limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, place it on the soft and scalded cowhide wound with sewing and press it; and do this several times, as it is wet and reduces itself to its position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder joint, which is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The shoulder joint of the hand is sometimes dislocated, and the reduction of the dislocation is easy, but on the contrary for other joints, however it requires speed in the reduction at the time of dislocation, before it becomes fixed or a cauterization occurs at the site.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The reduction of the dislocation is that you place the patient's hand joint on a table and extend their arm, then place your hand or palm over the edge of the joint, and push it back into its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it is important to consider whether the palm has already been left in the center of the hand, in which case you should place the patient's hands on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is preceded by this, then you should place the patient's hand in the intrinsic position on the table, so that the doctor's hand fits over the edge of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns quickly, that is good; otherwise, press it with a plaster allowing the site to heal and leave it; do not reapply it, as otherwise, it will cause pain or you may not be able to work on the reduction for some days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint returns according to its curvature; and do not tell the patient any cause, but let their hand become softened and unable to strengthen any cause; then know that the nerves are broken or crushed, and do not be cautious in this matter except when it is strengthened with a strong cautery for the healing of the site.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	When the shoulder is returned, press it with the plaster that has been recommended, and let it be left and strengthened for 5 days; then remove it and let the patient rest and exercise their arm.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	However, if the movement of the shoulder remains and there is gravity in it, you should soften it with hot water and massage it for several times until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the fingers are dislocated in various parts.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger of those is dislocated at the base or center of it, you should squeeze the finger and push the dislocation back with your thumbs until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the finger's head, and suspend the part to which it is dislocated, and let it rest for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then suspend it and extend it until it straightens on that same day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, let it rest according to the narrative, and do not cease to remove it during the day and exercise it with movement, and leave it at night; and do this for several days until it strengthens.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same for a dislocation of the wrist, and place it in that position, and perform the same first operation until it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly, do as you would for when it is dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the spinal vertebrae in the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a spine or neck vertebrae becomes dislocated and other vertebrae are also displaced along with it, that is not treatable because death awaits the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	A sign of this condition is that the patient's excretion is outside their will and they cannot retain it; and in many cases, some limbs or legs or arms, or one of them are swollen or affected by paralysis, or a vertebra has been dislocated from its place. In many cases, this means that the vertebra has moved and the patient is experiencing paralysis in four different areas.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has been dislocated in the rear area and is called sciatica. (This line appears to be an interpretation or explanation of the condition discussed earlier.)
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	However, the treatment of this condition is to consider whether sciatica occurs in childhood because in such cases, there is neither cure nor recovery for it. (This line appears to be a continuation of the previous explanation or interpretation.)
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in cases that occur from an accident or blow, or similar to those, the Ancients have described many ways of treatment at length, but I shall summarize it here as succinctly as possible, for brevity's sake; nevertheless, I have abbreviated this treatment method by omitting much of the detail, using more straightforward language to make the explanation clearer. With that said, I will now describe and elaborate on the instruments used in this method.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	It is stated that in sciatica that occurs in the front of the legs, there is neither treatment nor recovery for it; similarly, this applies to cases where it affects both legs. (This line appears to be a continuation of the previous explanation or interpretation.)
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	Only that type of sciatica is treated which occurs in the back, as I will recommend. (This line appears to be a conclusion or summary of the discussion about treatment for sciatica.)
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	The patient should be laid flat on their back and propped up with cushions or pillows to prevent the feet from touching the ground. (This line appears to describe a position for the patient during treatment of sciatica.)
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	A straight stick should be placed beneath the head at its foot end, and another stick under the feet at the other end of the bed. (This line appears to describe additional equipment or positioning for the patient during treatment of sciatica.)
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.
